summary: Single-page marketing website for HOTEL NASRA DA; user wants HND logo branding, menu items displayed with unique photos, improved UI polish, and now requests an per-item Order button that opens WhatsApp with a pre-filled message for that specific menu item.
architectural_notes: Menu content should be stored in the centralized content configuration (same TS object/file as other business details) and rendered as text (no menu image dependency).

Potential scope change: user requests images for each menu item, which conflicts with the prior requirement that the menu be text-only (no menu image dependency). Clarify/decide whether to allow per-item images and how they will be sourced/stored.
Branding update: add/use an 'HND' logo in the header/hero start area and remove/avoid the existing map logo.
Menu item imagery requirement: each menu item image must be distinct; avoid reusing the same photo across items.
User requested a navigation-driven/conditional rendering layout: keep Contact/Location on the main view and reveal other sections on button click (instead of showing all sections at once).

Ordering UX requirement: add a per-menu-item 'Order' CTA that deep-links to WhatsApp (wa.me / click-to-chat) with a prefilled message including the item name (and optionally price), so the user can order that specific item.
known_issues: Images are not displaying correctly on the site (user reported missing/incorrect image rendering).
Build/deployment failing due to a "System configuration error" (platform/system-level error).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website (single-page) for the place referenced by https://maps.app.goo.gl/NdbP8XBnMzZHEdmM8, with clear sections for: hero (name + short tagline), about/description, hours, address, contact (phone/email placeholders if not known), and a location section that includes a prominent button linking to the Google Maps URL.

Add an embedded map preview in the location section (e.g., Google Maps embed/iframe when feasible) and provide a graceful fallback to a static location card with the “Open in Google Maps” link if embedding is blocked by browser policy/config.

Establish a coherent visual theme and layout system for the site (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all sections. Choose a distinctive style appropriate for a local business website and avoid a blue/purple primary palette.

Add basic SEO and accessibility: set a descriptive page title and meta description, ensure headings use a logical hierarchy (H1/H2/H3), interactive elements are keyboard accessible, and key icons/images have appropriate alt text.

Include a simple, centralized content configuration (e.g., a single TS file/object) for business name, tagline, description, hours, address, and contact details, and wire the UI to read from it so updating site content is straightforward.
Add the required generated images to the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the hero and/or branding area of the site.
Update the site branding to use the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA” everywhere it appears (header/site title, hero H1, footer, and centralized content config).
Update SEO metadata to reflect the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA” by setting an appropriate HTML `<title>` and meta description in `frontend/index.html` (English).

Add a new text-based “Menu” section to the single-page site (do not display the uploaded menu images). The menu content must include all items and prices from the 4 uploaded menu images (FB_IMG_1771102731629.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102734566.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102727004.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102729097.jpg) transcribed into English text where needed and organized into clear categories.
Add navigation access to the new Menu section: include a “Menu” link/button in the fixed header navigation and in the footer quick links that smooth-scrolls to the Menu section.

Extend the centralized content configuration (`frontend/src/content/business.ts`) to include structured menu data (categories and items), and render the Menu section from this configuration so future edits do not require modifying React component markup.

Make the website use a premium dark UI as the default appearance (dark background, high-contrast readable typography, and refined surfaces), without adding any new site sections or changing existing content text.

Upgrade the Menu section UI to a more premium design: use a card/grid layout for menu items, improved spacing/typography, and more polished Tabs styling while keeping the existing tab categories and menu data structure-driven rendering.

Add an image/photo next to every menu item in the Menu section. Extend the centralized menu data in frontend/src/content/business.ts to support an image reference per item, and render that image for each menu item with accessible alt text.

Ensure every menu item displays a unique image (no repeated photos across different menu items) by updating `frontend/src/content/business.ts` so each menu item points to its own distinct static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated`.
Remove any visible 'PREMIUM' text from all generated food/menu photos used on the site and replace it with 'HND' on the image artwork itself (not as HTML overlay text).
Create and apply an 'HND' brand logo for the top/starting branding area and replace map/pin-style branding in the header, hero logo, and footer with the HND logo (do not use a map logo for branding).

Improve the overall UI polish (spacing, typography hierarchy, alignment, and component consistency) across the single-page site while keeping existing section structure and keeping user-facing text in English.

Change the homepage behavior so that not all sections are shown immediately: keep the main view focused on Contact and Location, and show other sections (e.g., About, Menu, Hours) only after the user clicks their respective navigation buttons.

Update header and footer navigation behavior so that section buttons both reveal the target section (if hidden) and then navigate/scroll to it; ensure Contact and Location remain accessible from the main view.

Fix the site images that are not displaying correctly (broken/missing images), especially menu item images, by ensuring image asset paths match actual files and adding a graceful UI fallback when an image fails to load.

Replace the current HND logo used in the header and hero with the user-provided HND logo image (uploaded as `Picsart_26-02-15_02-31-07-789.png`) by adding an optimized logo asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and updating the UI to reference it consistently (header logo, hero logo, and any other existing logo placements).

Update the Menu UI so that every menu item (across all categories/tabs) displays: (1) its unique photo (from `businessContent.menu[].items[].image`), (2) its name and price(s), and (3) an "Order on WhatsApp" button next to/on the item card. Ensure the layout is consistent across all tabs (no categories rendered as text-only lists).

Implement per-item WhatsApp ordering: clicking an item's "Order on WhatsApp" button must open WhatsApp (web/app) with a pre-filled message that includes the selected item name and any displayed price(s). Add a configurable WhatsApp phone number (international format) and an optional message template to `frontend/src/content/business.ts` and use it to generate the WhatsApp deep link.
Identify and fix the root cause of the Caffeine build/deployment failure that reports “System configuration error”, ensuring the project builds successfully in the platform environment.

Make the Tailwind configuration compatible with the build toolchain by removing any module-format mismatch (e.g., ESM-only imports/exports) that could break Tailwind/Vite processing in the deployment environment.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website for the business/location referenced by the provided Google Maps link.
Update site branding/content to use the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA”.
Add a Menu section with menu items/details as text/content (not as an image).
Switch the site UI to a premium dark theme design.
Enhance the Menu section with a premium design and add a photo/image for each menu item.
Ensure all menu item photos are unique (no repeated images).
Update/replace any 'PREMIUM' text on photos to 'HND' (remove 'PREMIUM').
Improve the overall UI styling ('UI acha sa bnao') beyond current premium dark theme.
Create an 'HND' logo and place it at the start/top; do not use the map logo.
Change the homepage layout so not everything is shown on the first view; show key content/sections when their respective buttons are clicked, while keeping Contact/Location visible on the main page.
Fix site images that are not displaying correctly (broken/missing/incorrect rendering).
Add an 'Order' button for each menu item that opens WhatsApp with a pre-filled message containing that selected item (and relevant details).

projectName: Create a single-page website for the Google Maps location
